column4: AMC Networks Inc., an entertainment company, distributes contents in the United States, Europe, and internationally. The company operates through two segments Domestic Operations and International. The Domestic Operations segment operates various programming networks, including the AMC, We tv, BBC AMERICA, IFC, and SundanceTV; provides subscription streaming services comprising Acorn TV, Shudder, Sundance Now, ALLBLK, and HIDIVE, as well as AMC+; and produces and licenses original programming, as well as engages in film distribution business under the IFC Films, RLJ Entertainment Films, and Shudder names. The International segment operates a portfolio of channels under the AMCNI name; and production and comedy venues activities under the Levity name. AMC Networks Inc. was founded in 1980 and is headquartered in New York, New York.
